issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
While debugging tests in eclipse, Cannot access DN http url. 
Also WebHdfs tests cannot run in eclipse due to classes loading from old version of netty jars instead of netty-all jar.
fields.summary: Remove classpath conflicts of netty-all jar in hadoop-hdfs-client

comments.body: Attached the patch to change the order

This message was automatically generated.

does this mean that there are conflicting versions of netty in the CP here? As that needs to be fixed. Changing the order of the CP simply by re-ordering declarations in maven is a dangerous approach as it's an mvn feature that most people don't know of, and isn't, AFAIK, guaranteed to hold over time

Yes you are right [~stevel@apache.org]. There are multiple versions of netty jars.

Attaching the patch to exclude duplicates.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |
